bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Alternative Names zhu chong shang 諸蟲傷 , all types of injury caused by bugs/worms. Pathological Condition Combined Designation of all types of skin damage, sometimes affecting the condition of the entire body, resulting from an insect bite or poisonous sting. Ri hua zi zhu jia ben cao 日華子諸家本草 Substance Entry shi yan 食 鹽：止風淚，邪氣，一切蟲傷瘡腫 , “It stops wind tears, evil qi, and all types of wounds caused by bugs/worms , with sores and swelling”. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Bai bing zhu zhi yao. Zhu chong shang 百病主治藥 諸蟲傷 identifies the following creatures as chong 蟲 : she hui 蛇虺 , poisonous snake; wu song 蜈蚣 , centipede; feng chai 蜂蠆 , bee/wasp and scorpion; zhi zhu 蜘蛛 , spider; qu 蠼螋 , earwig; can ci 蠶蛓 , silkworm; qiu yin 蚯蚓 , earthworm; wo niu 蝸牛 , snail; she gong 射 工 , “archer”; sha shi 沙虱 , sand louse; zhi 蛭 , leech; lou gu 螻蛄 , mole cricket; yi 蟻 , ant; ying 蠅 , house-fly; you yang 蚰蜒 , house-centipede. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 often combines the name of a bug/worm with the character shang 傷 , e. g., wu song shang 蜈蚣傷 , harm caused by a centipede; you yang shang 蚰蜒傷 , harm caused by a house-centiped; feng shang 蜂傷 , harm caused by bees, etc. The meaning of these terms is obvious; they do not have a separate entry in this dictionary.
